issue.title: ispreview.co.uk
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.5.2(1010)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.ispreview.co.uk

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Gap left in "Sponsored Links" section. I think this entire section - including header - should be removed.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/144827021/423e93e6-4cbe-42a5-ab14-05d68d1f43df)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: www.youtube.com
issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
It seems I may have spoken too soon. The issue is back, or maybe it never got solved, I don't know. My filters are up to date and I've enabled as many of them as I could.

I tested it here:
https://stream-together.org/watch10.html#&is_dark_theme=MQ&theme_color=MjM4N2Jk&custom_logo=aHR0cHM6Ly9hbmltZW5zaW9uLnRvL2Fzc2V0cy9pbWFnZXMvbG9nby5wbmc&title=UG9rZW1vbiUyMENvbmNpZXJnZSUyMEVwaXNvZGUlMjAx&back_button=aHR0cHM6Ly9hbmltZW5zaW9uLnRvLzQwNzI2NzU4NjU=&next_button=aHR0cHM6Ly9hbmltZW5zaW9uLnRvLzQwNzI2NzU4NjUjMTk2NjY4NzU0MA==&download=aHR0cHM6Ly9nb29uZS5wcm8vZG93bmxvYWQ/aWQ9TWpFM05qa3k=&disqus_id=YW5pbWVuc2lvbjIyMTE2ODc=&error_callback=aHR0cHM6Ly9hbmltZW5zaW9uLnRvL3B1YmxpYy1hcGkvZXJyb3JfcmVwb3J0aW5nLnBocD9pZD0zOTgwMzM0MDQ0

The only solution right now seems to be clicking on the option to switch to another server, so currently I'm watching the video with the VidStreaming server and not seeing any ads. It seems what causes the ads is related to the default VidCDN server.

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/artist/6t6aXZlmnAF1VuiG8BVjQZ](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2Fartist%2F6t6aXZlmnAF1VuiG8BVjQZ) ### Comment > spotify was working fine with brave + adguard a few days ago, now it just stops playing completely when there's an advertisement. i've tried with just brave ad protection, just adguard, with both, and with neither. if there's an ad blocker the music stops. without the ad blocker there are ads. since it's both ad blockers, it might be the spotify website itself, but please let me know if there's anything i can do to not watch ads + not have my music stop every couple of songs. Username: `@elysia831` ### [NSFW] Screenshots
Screenshot 1 [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/1rs73t4f8dvog0400gg8ow048ww00kwm8ptrh20n6s.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/i8h3xflxlxk44kskoo8cwkkcww4oo0ol2mh3wlynhc.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v4.2.241 System version: | Windows 10 Browser: | Brave Stealth mode: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Other:
Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion

Language-specific:
AdGuard Russian,
AdGuard Japanese Other extensions used: | google analytics opt-out add-on, brave browser (brave browser ad blocking has the same problem so maybe it's a problem with spotify's website)

issue.title: yingyongge.com: ads
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

N/A

Missed ads or ad leftovers

issue.title: www.cnbcindonesia.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.cnbcindonesia.com/tech/20240125161102-37-509004/alasan-gibran-dapat-duit-rp-3-triliun-terungkap](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnbcindonesia.com%2Ftech%2F20240125161102-37-509004%2Falasan-gibran-dapat-duit-rp-3-triliun-terungkap) ### Comment > not only this banner is annoying, but also i can't scroll the page because those banner. > > the step is: > 1. ensure to delete site's cookie (settings -> sites settings -> all sites -> cnbcindonesia.com) > 2. open the link > 3. don't click anything until everything loaded, this one important > 4. once everything loaded, there will be a banner with "consent" named button. click it > 5. then click "close ad" button in the back > 6. now the page froze. > > next time you reopen the page there will be no cookie banner. Therefore no issue, because the cookie already cached. Username: `@robifr` ### [NSFW] Screenshots
Screenshot 1 [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/8p93vn6mvi4g8ogccgs4w0c0840owwsbs0wq43d1n4.jpg?nc=1)
